hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "Whoever drinks alcoholic drinks in the world and does not repent (before 
dying), will be deprived of it in the Hereafter."
question: What are the consequences in the Hereafter for consuming alcoholic drinks without repentance?

hadith-eng:
On the night Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was taken on a night journey (Miraj) two cups, one containing wine and 
the other milk, were presented to him at Jerusalem. He looked at it and took the cup of milk. Gabriel 
said, "Praise be to Allah Who guided you to Al-Fitra (the right path); if you had taken (the cup of) 
wine, your nation would have gone astray."
question: What is the significance of choosing milk over wine in the context of guidance and the right path?

hadith-eng:
I heard from Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) a narration which none other than I will narrate to you. The Prophet, said, 
"From among the portents of the our are the following: General ignorance (in religious affairs) will 
prevail, (religious) knowledge will decrease, illegal sexual intercourse will prevail, alcoholic drinks 
will be drunk (in abundance), men will decrease and women will increase so much so that for every 
fifty women there will be one man to look after them."
question: What are some of the signs of the approaching Hour as mentioned in Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "An adulterer, at the time he is committing illegal sexual intercourse is not a 
believer; and a person, at the time of drinking an alcoholic drink is not a believer; and a thief, at the 
time of stealing, is not a believer." Ibn Shihab said: `Abdul Malik bin Abi Bakr bin `Abdur-Rahman 
bin Al- Harith bin Hisham told me that Abu Bakr used to narrate that narration to him on the authority 
of Abu Huraira. He used to add that Abu Bakr used to mention, besides the above cases, "And he who 
robs (takes illegally something by force) while the people are looking at him, is not a believer at the 
time he is robbing (taking).
question: What is the relationship between committing major sins and one's state of faith in Islam?

hadith-eng:
"Alcoholic drinks were prohibited (by Allah) when there was nothing of it (special kind of wine) in 
Medina.
question: What is the significance of the prohibition of alcoholic drinks in Islam?

hadith-eng:
"Alcoholic drinks were prohibited at the time we could rarely find wine made from grapes in Medina, 
for most of our liquors were made from unripe and ripe dates.
question: What was the common source of alcoholic drinks in Medina during the time of prohibition?

hadith-eng:
`Umar stood up on the pulpit and said, "Now then, prohibition of alcoholic drinks have been revealed, 
and these drinks are prepared from five things, i.e.. grapes, dates, honey, wheat or barley And an 
alcoholic drink is that, that disturbs the mind.
question: What are the sources from which alcoholic drinks can be prepared according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng:
I was serving Abu 'Ubaida, Abu Talha and Ubai bin Ka`b with a drink prepared from ripe and unripe 
dates. Then somebody came to them and said, "Alcoholic drinks have been prohibited." (On hearing 
that) Abu Talha said, "Get up. O Anas, and pour (throw) it out! So I poured (threw) it out.
question: How did the companions of the Prophet react to the prohibition of alcoholic drinks?

hadith-eng:
While I was waiting on my uncles and serving them with (wine prepared from) dates----and I was the 
youngest of them----it was said, "Alcoholic drinks have been prohibited." So they said (to me), 
"Throw it away." So I threw it away.
question: What was the reaction of the companions when they learned about the prohibition of alcoholic drinks?

hadith-eng:
Alcoholic drinks were prohibited. At that time these drinks used to be prepared from unripe and ripe 
dates.
question: What was the source of alcoholic drinks before they were prohibited in Islam?

hadith-eng: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was asked about Al-Bit. He said, "All drinks that intoxicate are unlawful (to drink.)
question: What is the Islamic ruling on consuming intoxicating drinks?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was asked about Al-Bit a liquor prepared from honey 
     which the Yemenites used to drink. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "All drinks 
     that intoxicate are unlawful (to drink)."
question: What is the Islamic ruling on consuming intoxicating substances?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "Do not make drinks in Ad-Dubba' nor in 
     Al-Muzaffat.  Abu Huraira used to add to them Al-Hantam and An-Naqir.
question: What are the specific containers mentioned that should not be used for making drinks?

hadith-eng:
`Umar delivered a sermon on the pulpit of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ), saying, "Alcoholic drinks were prohibited 
by Divine Order, and these drinks used to be prepared from five things, i.e., grapes, dates, wheat, 
barley and honey. Alcoholic drink is that, that disturbs the mind." `Umar added, "I wish Allah's 
Apostle had not left us before he had given us definite verdicts concerning three matters, i.e., how 
much a grandfather may inherit (of his grandson), the inheritance of Al-Kalala (the deceased person 
among whose heirs there is no father or son), and various types of Riba(1 ) (usury) ."
question: What are the sources from which alcoholic drinks were traditionally prepared according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng:
"Alcoholic drinks are prepared from five things, i.e., raisins, dates.
     wheat, barley and honey."
question: What are the sources from which alcoholic drinks can be prepared according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng:
that he heard the Prophet (ﷺ) saying, "From among my followers there will 
     be some people who will consider illegal sexual intercourse, the 
     wearing of silk, the drinking of alcoholic drinks and the use of 
     musical instruments, as lawful. And there will be some people who will
     stay near the side of a mountain and in the evening their shepherd 
     will come to them with their sheep and ask them for something, but 
     they will say to him, 'Return to us tomorrow.' Allah will destroy them
     during the night and will let the mountain fall on them, and He will 
     transform the rest of them into monkeys and pigs and they will remain 
     so till the Day of Resurrection."
question: What are the consequences mentioned for those who consider certain prohibited actions as lawful?

hadith-eng:
Abu Usaid As-Sa`idi came and invited Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) on the occasion of his wedding. His wife who 
was the bride, was serving them. Do you know what drink she prepared for Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) ? She had 
soaked some dates in water in a Tur overnight.
question: What is the significance of hospitality in Islamic tradition as demonstrated in this event?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade the use of (certain) containers, but the Ansar said, "We cannot dispense with 
them." The Prophet (ﷺ) then said, "If so, then use them."
question: What is the significance of flexibility and understanding in Islamic rulings when faced with practical difficulties?

hadith-eng:
When the Prophet (ﷺ) forbade the use of certain containers (that were used for preparing alcoholic drinks), 
somebody said to the Prophet (ﷺ) . "But not all the people can find skins." So he allowed them to use clay 
jars not covered with pitch.
question: What considerations did the Prophet (ﷺ) take into account when prohibiting certain containers for use?

hadith-eng: the Prophet (ﷺ) forbade the use of Ad-Dubba' and Al Muzaffat.A'mash also narrated this.
question: What are Ad-Dubba' and Al Muzaffat, and why were they forbidden by the Prophet (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng:
I asked Al-Aswad, "Did you ask `Aisha, Mother of the Believers, about the containers in which it is 
disliked to prepare (non-alcoholic) drinks?" He said, "Yes, I said to her, 'O Mother of the Believers! 
What containers did the Prophet (ﷺ) forbid to use for preparing (non-alcoholic) drinks?" She said, 'The 
Prophet forbade us, (his family), to prepare (nonalcoholic) drinks in Ad-Dubba and Al-Muzaffat.' I 
asked, 'Didn't you mention Al Jar and Al Hantam?' She said, 'I tell what I have heard; shall I tell you 
what I have not heard?' "
question: What types of containers were prohibited by the Prophet for preparing non-alcoholic drinks?

hadith-eng:
I heard `Abdullah bin Abi `Aufa saying, "The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade the use of green jars." I said, "Shall we 
drink out of white jars?" He said, "No."
question: What is the significance of the Prophet's prohibition on using certain types of jars?

hadith-eng:
Abu Usaid As Sa`idi invited the Prophet (ﷺ) to his wedding banquet. At that time his wife was serving 
them and she was the bride. She said, ''Do you know what (kind of syrup) I soaked (made) for Allah's 
Apostle? I soaked some dates in water in a Tur (bowl) overnight. '
question: What is the significance of inviting the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) to a wedding banquet in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng:
I asked Ibn `Abbas about Al-Badhaq. He said, "Muhammad prohibited alcoholic drinks before It was 
called Al-Badhaq (by saying), 'Any drink that intoxicates is unlawful.' I said, 'What about good lawful 
drinks?' He said,'Apart from what is lawful and good, all other things are unlawful and not good 
(unclean Al-Khabith).
question: What is the Islamic ruling on consuming intoxicating substances?

hadith-eng: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to like sweet edible things and honey.
question: What were some of the Prophet Muhammad's (ﷺ) preferences in food?

hadith-eng:
While I was serving Abu Talha. Abu Dujana and Abu Suhail bin Al-Baida' with a drink made from a 
mixture of unripe and ripe dates, alcoholic drinks, were made unlawful, whereupon I threw it away, 
and I was their butler and the youngest of them, and we used to consider that drink as an alcoholic 
drink in those days.
question: What was the reaction of the companions when alcoholic drinks were made unlawful in Islam?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade the drinking of alcoholic drinks prepared from raisins, dates, unripe dates and 
fresh ripe dates.
question: What types of substances are prohibited for consumption in Islam according to the teachings of the Prophet (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade the mixing of ripe and unripe dates and also the mixing of dates and raisins (for 
preparing a syrup) but the syrup of each kind of fruit should be prepared separately. ( One may have 
such drinks as long as it is fresh )
question: What are the guidelines for mixing different types of fruits when preparing a syrup in Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was presented a bowl of milk and a bowl of wine on the night he was taken on a 
journey (Al-Mi'raj).
question: What significance does the choice between milk and wine hold in Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng:
The people doubted whether Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was fasting or the Day of `Arafat or not. So I sent a cup 
containing milk to him and he drank it.
question: What can be inferred about the actions of the Prophet (ﷺ) regarding fasting on the Day of `Arafat?

hadith-eng:
Abu Humaid brought a cup of mix from a place called Al-Naqi. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said to him, "Will you 
not cover it, even by placing a stick across its"
question: What is the significance of covering food and drink in Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng:
Abu Humaid, an Ansari man, came from AnNaqi carrying a cup of milk to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) 
said, "Will you not cover it even by placing a stick across it?"
question: What is the significance of covering food and drink in Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (ﷺ) came from Mecca with Abu Bakr. Abu Bakr said "We passed by a shepherd and at that 
time Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was thirsty. I milked a little milk in a bowl and Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) drank till I was 
pleased. Suraqa bin Ju'shum came to us riding a horse (chasing us). The Prophet (ﷺ) invoked evil upon 
him, whereupon Suraqa requested him not to invoke evil upon him, in which case he would go back. 
The Prophet (ﷺ) agreed.
question: What can be learned about the Prophet's (ﷺ) interactions with others during times of need and pursuit?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "The best object of charity is a she-camel which has (newly) given birth and 
gives plenty of milk, or a she-goat which gives plenty of milk; and is given to somebody to utilize its 
milk by milking one bowl in the morning and one in the evening."
question: What is considered the best form of charity in terms of livestock according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) drank milk and then rinsed his mouth and said, "It contains fat."
question: What is the significance of rinsing the mouth after consuming certain foods or drinks in Islam?

hadith-eng:
I was raised to the Lote Tree and saw four rivers, two of which were coming out and two going in. 
Those which were coming out were the Nile and the Euphrates, and those which were going in were two rivers in paradise. Then I was given three bowls, one containing milk, and another containing honey, and a third containing wine. I took the bowl containing milk and drank it. It was said to me, "You and your followers will be on the right path (of Islam)."
question: What is the significance of the Lote Tree in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng:
Abu Talha had the largest number of datepalms from amongst the Ansars of Medina. The dearest of 
his property to him was Bairuha garden which was facing the (Prophet's) Mosque. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) 
used to enter it and drink of its good fresh water. When the Holy Verse:-- 'By no means shall you 
attain righteousness unless you spend (in charity) of that which you love.' (3.92) was revealed, Abu 
Talha got up and said, "O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)! Allah says: By no means shall you attain righteousness 
unless you spend of that which you love,' and the dearest of my property to me is the Bairuha garden 
and I want to give it in charity in Allah's Cause, seeking to be rewarded by Allah for that. So you can 
spend it, O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ), where-ever Allah instructs you. ' Allah s Apostle said, "Good! That is a 
perishable (or profitable) wealth" (`Abdullah is in doubt as to which word was used.) He said, "I have 
heard what you have said but in my opinion you'd better give it to your kith and kin." On that Abu 
Talha said, "I will do so, O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)!" Abu Talha distributed that garden among his kith and kin 
and cousins.
question: What is the significance of giving in charity from one's most cherished possessions in Islam?

hadith-eng:
I saw Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) drinking milk. He came to my house and I milked a sheep and then mixed the 
milk with water from the well for Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). He took the bowl and drank while on his left there 
was sitting Abu Bakr, and on his right there was a bedouin. He then gave the remaining milk to the 
bedouin and said, "The right! The right (first).
question: What is the significance of giving preference to the person on the right in Islamic etiquette?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and one of his companions entered upon an Ansari man and the Prophet (ﷺ) said to him, 
"If you have water kept overnight in a water skin, (give us), otherwise we will drink water by putting 
our mouth in it." The man was watering his garden then. He said, "O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)! I have water 
kept overnight; let us go to the shade." So he took them both there and poured water into a bowl and 
milked a domestic goat of his in it. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) drank, and then the man who had come along with 
him, drank.
question: What is the significance of hospitality in Islamic teachings as demonstrated by the actions of the Ansari man?

hadith-eng: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to like sweet edible things (syrup, etc.) and honey.
question: What were some of the food preferences of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng:
Ali came to the gate of the courtyard (of the Mosque) and drank (water) while he was standing and 
said, "Some people dislike to drink while standing, but I saw the Prophet (ﷺ) doing (drinking water) as 
you have seen me doing now."
question: What is the significance of following the actions of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) in daily practices?

hadith-eng:
`Ali offered the Zuhr prayer and then sat down in the wide courtyard (of the Mosque) of Kufa in order 
to deal with the affairs of the people till the `Asr prayer became due. Then water was brought to him 
and he drank of it, washed his face, hands, head and feet. Then he stood up and drank the remaining 
water while he was standing. and said, "Some people dislike to drink water while standing thought the 
Prophet did as I have just done."
question: What actions did Ali perform before and after the Zuhr prayer in the courtyard of the Mosque of Kufa?

hadith-eng: The Prophet (ﷺ) drank Zamzam (water) while standing.
question: What is the significance of drinking Zamzam water in Islam?

hadith-eng:
(daughter of Al-Harith) that she sent a bowl of milk to the Prophet (ﷺ) while he was standing (at `Arafat) 
in the afternoon of the Day of `Arafat. He took it in his hands and drank it. Narrated Abu Nadr: The 
Prophet was on the back of his camel.
question: What is the significance of drinking milk during the Day of Arafat according to Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng:
Milk mixed with water was brought to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) while a bedouin was on his right and Abu Bakr 
was on his left. He drank (of it) and then gave (it) to the bedouin and said, 'The right" "The right 
(first).
question: What is the significance of giving preference to the person on the right in Islamic etiquette?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was offered something to drink. He drank of it while on his right was a boy and on his 
left were some elderly people. He said to the boy, "May I give these (elderly) people first?" The boy 
said, "By Allah, O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)! I will not give up my share from you to somebody else." On that 
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) placed the cup in the hand of that boy.
question: What does this incident teach about the rights of individuals in Islamic etiquette?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (ﷺ) and one of his companions entered upon an Ansari man. The Prophet (ﷺ) and his companion 
greeted (the man) and he replied, "O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)! Let my father and mother be sacrificed for you! 
It is hot," while he was watering his garden. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked him, "If you have water kept overnight 
in a water skin, (give us), or else we will drink by putting our mouths in the basin." The man was 
watering the garden The man said, "O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)! I have water kept overnight in a water-skin. He 
went to the shade and poured some water into a bowl and milked some milk from a domestic goat in 
it. The Prophet (ﷺ) drank and then gave the bowl to the man who had come along with him to drink.
question: What is the significance of hospitality in Islamic teachings as demonstrated by the actions of the Ansari man?

hadith-eng:
I was waiting on my uncles, serving them with an alcoholic drink prepared from dates, and I was the 
youngest of them. (Suddenly) it was said that alcoholic drinks had been prohibited. So they said (to 
me), 'Throw it away." And I threw it away The sub-narrator said: I asked Anas what their drink was 
(made from), He replied, "(From) ripe dates and unripe dates."
question: What was the reaction of the companions when they learned about the prohibition of alcoholic drinks?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "When night falls (or when it is evening), stop your children from going out, for 
the devils spread out at that time. But when an hour of the night has passed, release them and close the 
doors and mention Allah's Name, for Satan does not open a closed door. Tie the mouth of your waterskin 
and mention Allah's Name; cover your containers and utensils and mention Allah's Name. Cover 
them even by placing something across it, and extinguish your lamps. "
question: What precautions should be taken during the evening to protect against the influence of devils?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "Extinguish the lamps when you go to bed; close your doors; tie the mouths of 
your water skins, and cover the food and drinks." I think he added, ". . . even with a stick you place 
across the container."
question: What precautions should be taken before going to bed according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade the bending of the mouths of water skins for the sake of drinking from them.
question: What are the potential health or hygiene concerns associated with drinking directly from water skins?

hadith-eng:
I heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbidding the drinking of water by bending the mouths of water skins, i.e., 
drinking from the mouths directly.
question: What are the potential health or hygiene concerns associated with drinking directly from the mouths of water skins?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade drinking directly from the mouth of a water skin or other leather containers. 
and forbade preventing one's neighbor from fixing a peg in (the wall of) one's house.
question: What are the etiquettes of drinking water as taught by the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng: The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade the drinking of water directly from the mouth of a water skin .
question: What are the potential health or hygiene concerns associated with drinking directly from a water skin?

hadith-eng: The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade the drinking of water direct from the mouth of a water-skin.
question: What are the potential health or safety concerns associated with drinking directly from a water-skin?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "When you drink (water), do not breath in the vessel; and when you urinate, do 
not touch your penis with your right hand. And when you cleanse yourself after defecation, do not use 
your right hand."
question: What are the etiquettes of drinking water as taught by the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng:
Anas used to breathe twice or thrice in the vessel (while drinking) and used to say that the Prophet; 
used to take three breaths while drinking.
question: What is the significance of taking multiple breaths while drinking in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng:
While Hudhaita was at Mada'in, he asked for water. The chief of the village brought him a silver 
vessel. Hudhaifa threw it away and said, "I have thrown it away because I told him not to use it, but he 
has not stopped using it. The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade us to wear clothes of silk or Dibaj, and to drink in gold 
or silver utensils, and said, 'These things are for them (unbelievers) in this world and for you 
(Muslims) in the Hereafter.' "
question: What are the Islamic guidelines regarding the use of gold and silver utensils?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Do not drink in gold or silver utensils, and do not wear clothes of silk or Dibaj, for 
these things are for them (unbelievers) in this world and for you in the Hereafter."
question: What is the Islamic perspective on using gold and silver utensils?

hadith-eng:
(the wife of the Prophet) Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "He who drinks in silver utensils is only filling his 
`Abdomen with Hell Fire."
question: What is the Islamic ruling on using silver utensils for drinking?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) ordered us to do seven things and forbade us from seven. He ordered us to visit the 
sick, to follow funeral processions, (to say) to a sneezer, (May Allah bestow His Mercy on you, if he 
says, Praise be to Allah), to accept invitations, to greet (everybody), to help the oppressed and to help 
others to fulfill their oaths. He forbade us to wear gold rings, to drink in silver (utensils), to use 
Mayathir (silken carpets placed on saddles), to wear Al-Qissi (a kind of silken cloth), to wear silk, 
Dibaj or Istabraq (two kinds of silk).
question: What are the seven actions that are encouraged in Islam according to this narration?

hadith-eng:
that the people were in doubt whether the Prophet (ﷺ) was fasting on the Day of `Arafat or not, so a 
(wooden) drinking vessel full of milk was sent to him, and he drank it.
question: What can be inferred about the Prophet's actions regarding fasting on the Day of `Arafat?

hadith-eng:
An Arab lady was mentioned to the Prophet (ﷺ) so he asked Abu Usaid As-Sa`idi to send for her, and he 
sent for her and she came and stayed in the castle of Bani Sa`ida. The Prophet (ﷺ) came out and went to 
her and entered upon her. Behold, it was a lady sitting with a drooping head. When the Prophet (ﷺ) spoke 
to her, she said, "I seek refuge with Allah from you." He said, "I grant you refuge from me." They said 
to her, "Do you know who this is?" She said, "No." They said, "This is Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) who has come 
to command your hand in marriage." She said, "I am very unlucky to lose this chance." Then the 
Prophet and his companions went towards the shed of Bani Sa`ida and sat there. Then he said, "Give 
us water, O Sahl!" So I took out this drinking bowl and gave them water in it. The sub-narrator added: 
Sahl took out for us that very drinking bowl and we all drank from it. Later on `Umar bin `Abdul 
`Aziz requested Sahl to give it to him as a present, and he gave it to him as a present.
question: What is the significance of seeking refuge in Allah when feeling uncomfortable or threatened?

hadith-eng:
I saw the drinking bowl of the Prophet (ﷺ) with Anas bin Malik, and it had been broken, and he had 
mended it with silver plates. That drinking bowl was quite wide and made of Nadar wood, Anas said, 
"I gave water to the Prophet (ﷺ) in that bowl more than so-and-so (for a long period)." Ibn Seereen said: 
Around that bowl there was an iron ring, and Anas wanted to replace it with a silver or gold ring, but 
Abu Talha said to him, "Do not change a thing that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) has made." So Anas left it as it 
was.
question: What is the significance of preserving items used by the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) in their original state?

hadith-eng:
I was with the Prophet (ﷺ) and the time for the `Asr prayer became due. We had no water with us except a 
little which was put in a vessel and was brought to the Prophet (ﷺ) . He put his hand into it and spread out 
his fingers and then said, "Come along! Hurry up! All those who want to perform ablution. The 
blessing is from Allah.'' I saw the water gushing out from his fingers. So the people performed the 
ablution and drank, and I tried to drink more of that water (beyond my thirst and capacity), for I knew 
that it was a blessing. The sub-narrator said: I asked Jabir, "How many persons were you then?" He 
replied, "We were one-thousand four hundred men." Salim said: Jabir said, 1500.
question: What is the significance of miracles in strengthening the faith of the companions of the Prophet?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "Whoever drinks alcoholic drinks in the world and does not repent (before 
dying), will be deprived of it in the Hereafter."
question: How does repentance affect one's eligibility for certain rewards in the Hereafter?

hadith-eng:
On the night Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was taken on a night journey (Miraj) two cups, one containing wine and 
the other milk, were presented to him at Jerusalem. He looked at it and took the cup of milk. Gabriel 
said, "Praise be to Allah Who guided you to Al-Fitra (the right path); if you had taken (the cup of) 
wine, your nation would have gone astray."
question: How does the choice made by the Prophet during the night journey reflect on the spiritual direction of his nation?

hadith-eng:
I heard from Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) a narration which none other than I will narrate to you. The Prophet, said, 
"From among the portents of the our are the following: General ignorance (in religious affairs) will 
prevail, (religious) knowledge will decrease, illegal sexual intercourse will prevail, alcoholic drinks 
will be drunk (in abundance), men will decrease and women will increase so much so that for every 
fifty women there will be one man to look after them."
question: How does the prevalence of ignorance and decrease in religious knowledge relate to the signs of the end times?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "An adulterer, at the time he is committing illegal sexual intercourse is not a 
believer; and a person, at the time of drinking an alcoholic drink is not a believer; and a thief, at the 
time of stealing, is not a believer." Ibn Shihab said: `Abdul Malik bin Abi Bakr bin `Abdur-Rahman 
bin Al- Harith bin Hisham told me that Abu Bakr used to narrate that narration to him on the authority 
of Abu Huraira. He used to add that Abu Bakr used to mention, besides the above cases, "And he who 
robs (takes illegally something by force) while the people are looking at him, is not a believer at the 
time he is robbing (taking).
question: How does the act of committing sins like theft or adultery affect a person's belief according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng:
"Alcoholic drinks were prohibited (by Allah) when there was nothing of it (special kind of wine) in 
Medina.
question: How did the prohibition of alcohol impact the society in Medina at the time of the Prophet?

hadith-eng:
"Alcoholic drinks were prohibited at the time we could rarely find wine made from grapes in Medina, 
for most of our liquors were made from unripe and ripe dates.
question: How did the prohibition of alcoholic drinks impact the consumption of wine made from grapes in Medina?

hadith-eng:
`Umar stood up on the pulpit and said, "Now then, prohibition of alcoholic drinks have been revealed, 
and these drinks are prepared from five things, i.e.. grapes, dates, honey, wheat or barley And an 
alcoholic drink is that, that disturbs the mind.
question: How is an alcoholic drink defined in terms of its effect on the mind in Islamic jurisprudence?

hadith-eng:
I was serving Abu 'Ubaida, Abu Talha and Ubai bin Ka`b with a drink prepared from ripe and unripe 
dates. Then somebody came to them and said, "Alcoholic drinks have been prohibited." (On hearing 
that) Abu Talha said, "Get up. O Anas, and pour (throw) it out! So I poured (threw) it out.
question: What actions were taken by the companions upon learning about the prohibition of alcohol in Islam?

hadith-eng:
While I was waiting on my uncles and serving them with (wine prepared from) dates----and I was the 
youngest of them----it was said, "Alcoholic drinks have been prohibited." So they said (to me), 
"Throw it away." So I threw it away.
question: How did the companions demonstrate obedience to new Islamic rulings during the time of the Prophet?

hadith-eng:
Alcoholic drinks were prohibited. At that time these drinks used to be prepared from unripe and ripe 
dates.
question: How did the prohibition of alcoholic drinks impact the practices of preparing beverages in early Islamic society?

hadith-eng: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was asked about Al-Bit. He said, "All drinks that intoxicate are unlawful (to drink.)
question: How does Islam define substances that are considered unlawful to consume?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was asked about Al-Bit a liquor prepared from honey 
     which the Yemenites used to drink. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "All drinks 
     that intoxicate are unlawful (to drink)."
question: How does Islam view the consumption of drinks that cause intoxication?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "Do not make drinks in Ad-Dubba' nor in 
     Al-Muzaffat.  Abu Huraira used to add to them Al-Hantam and An-Naqir.
question: Why might certain types of containers be prohibited for making drinks in Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng:
`Umar delivered a sermon on the pulpit of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ), saying, "Alcoholic drinks were prohibited 
by Divine Order, and these drinks used to be prepared from five things, i.e., grapes, dates, wheat, 
barley and honey. Alcoholic drink is that, that disturbs the mind." `Umar added, "I wish Allah's 
Apostle had not left us before he had given us definite verdicts concerning three matters, i.e., how 
much a grandfather may inherit (of his grandson), the inheritance of Al-Kalala (the deceased person 
among whose heirs there is no father or son), and various types of Riba(1 ) (usury) ."
question: What are the implications of alcohol consumption on the mind as mentioned in Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng:
"Alcoholic drinks are prepared from five things, i.e., raisins, dates.
     wheat, barley and honey."
question: How does Islam categorize substances like raisins, dates, wheat, barley, and honey in the context of alcohol production?

hadith-eng:
that he heard the Prophet (ﷺ) saying, "From among my followers there will 
     be some people who will consider illegal sexual intercourse, the 
     wearing of silk, the drinking of alcoholic drinks and the use of 
     musical instruments, as lawful. And there will be some people who will
     stay near the side of a mountain and in the evening their shepherd 
     will come to them with their sheep and ask them for something, but 
     they will say to him, 'Return to us tomorrow.' Allah will destroy them
     during the night and will let the mountain fall on them, and He will 
     transform the rest of them into monkeys and pigs and they will remain 
     so till the Day of Resurrection."
question: How does the hadith describe the transformation of people who engage in certain sinful behaviors?

hadith-eng:
Abu Usaid As-Sa`idi came and invited Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) on the occasion of his wedding. His wife who 
was the bride, was serving them. Do you know what drink she prepared for Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) ? She had 
soaked some dates in water in a Tur overnight.
question: How were drinks traditionally prepared and served during the time of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade the use of (certain) containers, but the Ansar said, "We cannot dispense with 
them." The Prophet (ﷺ) then said, "If so, then use them."
question: How does the interaction between the Prophet and the Ansar illustrate the balance between religious directives and community needs?

hadith-eng:
When the Prophet (ﷺ) forbade the use of certain containers (that were used for preparing alcoholic drinks), 
somebody said to the Prophet (ﷺ) . "But not all the people can find skins." So he allowed them to use clay 
jars not covered with pitch.
question: How did the Prophet (ﷺ) address the concerns of people who could not find alternative containers?

hadith-eng: the Prophet (ﷺ) forbade the use of Ad-Dubba' and Al Muzaffat.A'mash also narrated this.
question: What is the significance of prohibiting certain items or practices in Islam?

hadith-eng:
I asked Al-Aswad, "Did you ask `Aisha, Mother of the Believers, about the containers in which it is 
disliked to prepare (non-alcoholic) drinks?" He said, "Yes, I said to her, 'O Mother of the Believers! 
What containers did the Prophet (ﷺ) forbid to use for preparing (non-alcoholic) drinks?" She said, 'The 
Prophet forbade us, (his family), to prepare (nonalcoholic) drinks in Ad-Dubba and Al-Muzaffat.' I 
asked, 'Didn't you mention Al Jar and Al Hantam?' She said, 'I tell what I have heard; shall I tell you 
what I have not heard?' "
question: How did Aisha, the Mother of the Believers, respond when asked about the containers forbidden by the Prophet?

hadith-eng:
I heard `Abdullah bin Abi `Aufa saying, "The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade the use of green jars." I said, "Shall we 
drink out of white jars?" He said, "No."
question: How does the guidance on the use of jars reflect on the broader principles of Islamic dietary laws?

hadith-eng:
Abu Usaid As Sa`idi invited the Prophet (ﷺ) to his wedding banquet. At that time his wife was serving 
them and she was the bride. She said, ''Do you know what (kind of syrup) I soaked (made) for Allah's 
Apostle? I soaked some dates in water in a Tur (bowl) overnight. '
question: How were traditional drinks prepared and served during the time of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng:
I asked Ibn `Abbas about Al-Badhaq. He said, "Muhammad prohibited alcoholic drinks before It was 
called Al-Badhaq (by saying), 'Any drink that intoxicates is unlawful.' I said, 'What about good lawful 
drinks?' He said,'Apart from what is lawful and good, all other things are unlawful and not good 
(unclean Al-Khabith).
question: How does Islam differentiate between lawful and unlawful drinks?

hadith-eng: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to like sweet edible things and honey.
question: How did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) view sweet foods and honey?

hadith-eng:
While I was serving Abu Talha. Abu Dujana and Abu Suhail bin Al-Baida' with a drink made from a 
mixture of unripe and ripe dates, alcoholic drinks, were made unlawful, whereupon I threw it away, 
and I was their butler and the youngest of them, and we used to consider that drink as an alcoholic 
drink in those days.
question: How did the companions of the Prophet (ﷺ) respond to the prohibition of alcohol?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade the drinking of alcoholic drinks prepared from raisins, dates, unripe dates and 
fresh ripe dates.
question: Why is the consumption of alcoholic beverages discouraged in Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade the mixing of ripe and unripe dates and also the mixing of dates and raisins (for 
preparing a syrup) but the syrup of each kind of fruit should be prepared separately. ( One may have 
such drinks as long as it is fresh )
question: Why is it important to prepare syrups from each type of fruit separately according to Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was presented a bowl of milk and a bowl of wine on the night he was taken on a 
journey (Al-Mi'raj).
question: What does the event of Al-Mi'raj signify in the life of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng:
The people doubted whether Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was fasting or the Day of `Arafat or not. So I sent a cup 
containing milk to him and he drank it.
question: How can the actions of the Prophet (ﷺ) clarify doubts about religious practices?

hadith-eng:
Abu Humaid brought a cup of mix from a place called Al-Naqi. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said to him, "Will you 
not cover it, even by placing a stick across its"
question: How can one ensure the protection of food and drink from impurities or harm?

hadith-eng:
Abu Humaid, an Ansari man, came from AnNaqi carrying a cup of milk to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) 
said, "Will you not cover it even by placing a stick across it?"
question: How can one ensure the protection of food and drink from impurities or harm?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (ﷺ) came from Mecca with Abu Bakr. Abu Bakr said "We passed by a shepherd and at that 
time Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was thirsty. I milked a little milk in a bowl and Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) drank till I was 
pleased. Suraqa bin Ju'shum came to us riding a horse (chasing us). The Prophet (ﷺ) invoked evil upon 
him, whereupon Suraqa requested him not to invoke evil upon him, in which case he would go back. 
The Prophet (ﷺ) agreed.
question: How did the Prophet (ﷺ) respond to requests for mercy from those who initially opposed him?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "The best object of charity is a she-camel which has (newly) given birth and 
gives plenty of milk, or a she-goat which gives plenty of milk; and is given to somebody to utilize its 
milk by milking one bowl in the morning and one in the evening."
question: How can the act of giving a milk-producing animal as charity benefit the recipient?

hadith-eng: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) drank milk and then rinsed his mouth and said, "It contains fat."
question: How does the consumption of milk relate to dietary practices in Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng:
I was raised to the Lote Tree and saw four rivers, two of which were coming out and two going in. 
Those which were coming out were the Nile and the Euphrates, and those which were going in were two rivers in paradise. Then I was given three bowls, one containing milk, and another containing honey, and a third containing wine. I took the bowl containing milk and drank it. It was said to me, "You and your followers will be on the right path (of Islam)."
question: What do the rivers mentioned in the hadith symbolize in Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng:
Abu Talha had the largest number of datepalms from amongst the Ansars of Medina. The dearest of 
his property to him was Bairuha garden which was facing the (Prophet's) Mosque. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) 
used to enter it and drink of its good fresh water. When the Holy Verse:-- 'By no means shall you 
attain righteousness unless you spend (in charity) of that which you love.' (3.92) was revealed, Abu 
Talha got up and said, "O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)! Allah says: By no means shall you attain righteousness 
unless you spend of that which you love,' and the dearest of my property to me is the Bairuha garden 
and I want to give it in charity in Allah's Cause, seeking to be rewarded by Allah for that. So you can 
spend it, O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ), where-ever Allah instructs you. ' Allah s Apostle said, "Good! That is a 
perishable (or profitable) wealth" (`Abdullah is in doubt as to which word was used.) He said, "I have 
heard what you have said but in my opinion you'd better give it to your kith and kin." On that Abu 
Talha said, "I will do so, O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)!" Abu Talha distributed that garden among his kith and kin 
and cousins.
question: How does the concept of righteousness relate to spending in charity according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng:
I saw Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) drinking milk. He came to my house and I milked a sheep and then mixed the 
milk with water from the well for Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). He took the bowl and drank while on his left there 
was sitting Abu Bakr, and on his right there was a bedouin. He then gave the remaining milk to the 
bedouin and said, "The right! The right (first).
question: How did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) demonstrate hospitality and sharing in this scenario?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and one of his companions entered upon an Ansari man and the Prophet (ﷺ) said to him, 
"If you have water kept overnight in a water skin, (give us), otherwise we will drink water by putting 
our mouth in it." The man was watering his garden then. He said, "O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)! I have water 
kept overnight; let us go to the shade." So he took them both there and poured water into a bowl and 
milked a domestic goat of his in it. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) drank, and then the man who had come along with 
him, drank.
question: How does the practice of sharing resources, like water, reflect the values of community and generosity in Islam?

hadith-eng: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to like sweet edible things (syrup, etc.) and honey.
question: How did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) view sweet foods and honey?

hadith-eng:
Ali came to the gate of the courtyard (of the Mosque) and drank (water) while he was standing and 
said, "Some people dislike to drink while standing, but I saw the Prophet (ﷺ) doing (drinking water) as 
you have seen me doing now."
question: How does the practice of drinking water while standing relate to the traditions of the Prophet (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng:
`Ali offered the Zuhr prayer and then sat down in the wide courtyard (of the Mosque) of Kufa in order 
to deal with the affairs of the people till the `Asr prayer became due. Then water was brought to him 
and he drank of it, washed his face, hands, head and feet. Then he stood up and drank the remaining 
water while he was standing. and said, "Some people dislike to drink water while standing thought the 
Prophet did as I have just done."
question: What is the significance of drinking water while standing according to the practices of the Prophet?

hadith-eng: The Prophet (ﷺ) drank Zamzam (water) while standing.
question: Is there any specific posture recommended for drinking Zamzam water?

hadith-eng:
(daughter of Al-Harith) that she sent a bowl of milk to the Prophet (ﷺ) while he was standing (at `Arafat) 
in the afternoon of the Day of `Arafat. He took it in his hands and drank it. Narrated Abu Nadr: The 
Prophet was on the back of his camel.
question: How does the Prophet's action of drinking milk at Arafat reflect on the permissibility of consuming food and drink during certain rituals?

hadith-eng:
Milk mixed with water was brought to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) while a bedouin was on his right and Abu Bakr 
was on his left. He drank (of it) and then gave (it) to the bedouin and said, 'The right" "The right 
(first).
question: How does the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) demonstrate fairness and respect in social gatherings?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was offered something to drink. He drank of it while on his right was a boy and on his 
left were some elderly people. He said to the boy, "May I give these (elderly) people first?" The boy 
said, "By Allah, O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)! I will not give up my share from you to somebody else." On that 
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) placed the cup in the hand of that boy.
question: How does the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) demonstrate fairness and respect for the rights of others in this situation?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (ﷺ) and one of his companions entered upon an Ansari man. The Prophet (ﷺ) and his companion 
greeted (the man) and he replied, "O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)! Let my father and mother be sacrificed for you! 
It is hot," while he was watering his garden. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked him, "If you have water kept overnight 
in a water skin, (give us), or else we will drink by putting our mouths in the basin." The man was 
watering the garden The man said, "O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)! I have water kept overnight in a water-skin. He 
went to the shade and poured some water into a bowl and milked some milk from a domestic goat in 
it. The Prophet (ﷺ) drank and then gave the bowl to the man who had come along with him to drink.
question: How does the sharing of food and drink reflect the values of community and brotherhood in Islam?

hadith-eng:
I was waiting on my uncles, serving them with an alcoholic drink prepared from dates, and I was the 
youngest of them. (Suddenly) it was said that alcoholic drinks had been prohibited. So they said (to 
me), 'Throw it away." And I threw it away The sub-narrator said: I asked Anas what their drink was 
(made from), He replied, "(From) ripe dates and unripe dates."
question: How did the companions dispose of alcoholic drinks upon hearing about their prohibition?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "When night falls (or when it is evening), stop your children from going out, for 
the devils spread out at that time. But when an hour of the night has passed, release them and close the 
doors and mention Allah's Name, for Satan does not open a closed door. Tie the mouth of your waterskin 
and mention Allah's Name; cover your containers and utensils and mention Allah's Name. Cover 
them even by placing something across it, and extinguish your lamps. "
question: Why is it important to mention Allah's Name when closing doors and covering containers?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "Extinguish the lamps when you go to bed; close your doors; tie the mouths of 
your water skins, and cover the food and drinks." I think he added, ". . . even with a stick you place 
across the container."
question: How can one ensure the safety of their home and belongings during the night?

hadith-eng: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade the bending of the mouths of water skins for the sake of drinking from them.
question: Why might it be important to follow specific etiquettes or guidelines when consuming food or drink in Islam?

hadith-eng:
I heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbidding the drinking of water by bending the mouths of water skins, i.e., 
drinking from the mouths directly.
question: What are the etiquettes of drinking water as taught by the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade drinking directly from the mouth of a water skin or other leather containers. 
and forbade preventing one's neighbor from fixing a peg in (the wall of) one's house.
question: How does Islam emphasize the importance of maintaining good relations with neighbors?

hadith-eng: The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade the drinking of water directly from the mouth of a water skin .
question: What are the etiquettes of drinking water in Islam as taught by the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng: The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade the drinking of water direct from the mouth of a water-skin.
question: What guidance does Islam provide regarding the manner of drinking water?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "When you drink (water), do not breath in the vessel; and when you urinate, do 
not touch your penis with your right hand. And when you cleanse yourself after defecation, do not use 
your right hand."
question: Why is it advised not to use the right hand for certain personal hygiene tasks in Islam?

hadith-eng:
Anas used to breathe twice or thrice in the vessel (while drinking) and used to say that the Prophet; 
used to take three breaths while drinking.
question: How did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) practice drinking water according to his companions?

hadith-eng:
While Hudhaita was at Mada'in, he asked for water. The chief of the village brought him a silver 
vessel. Hudhaifa threw it away and said, "I have thrown it away because I told him not to use it, but he 
has not stopped using it. The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade us to wear clothes of silk or Dibaj, and to drink in gold 
or silver utensils, and said, 'These things are for them (unbelievers) in this world and for you 
(Muslims) in the Hereafter.' "
question: Why are certain luxurious items reserved for the Hereafter according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Do not drink in gold or silver utensils, and do not wear clothes of silk or Dibaj, for 
these things are for them (unbelievers) in this world and for you in the Hereafter."
question: Why are silk and Dibaj clothes prohibited for believers in this world?

hadith-eng:
(the wife of the Prophet) Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "He who drinks in silver utensils is only filling his 
`Abdomen with Hell Fire."
question: What are the consequences mentioned for those who drink from silver utensils?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) ordered us to do seven things and forbade us from seven. He ordered us to visit the 
sick, to follow funeral processions, (to say) to a sneezer, (May Allah bestow His Mercy on you, if he 
says, Praise be to Allah), to accept invitations, to greet (everybody), to help the oppressed and to help 
others to fulfill their oaths. He forbade us to wear gold rings, to drink in silver (utensils), to use 
Mayathir (silken carpets placed on saddles), to wear Al-Qissi (a kind of silken cloth), to wear silk, 
Dibaj or Istabraq (two kinds of silk).
question: What are the seven prohibitions mentioned in this narration?

hadith-eng:
that the people were in doubt whether the Prophet (ﷺ) was fasting on the Day of `Arafat or not, so a 
(wooden) drinking vessel full of milk was sent to him, and he drank it.
question: How did the Prophet's consumption of milk clarify the doubts of the people?

hadith-eng:
An Arab lady was mentioned to the Prophet (ﷺ) so he asked Abu Usaid As-Sa`idi to send for her, and he 
sent for her and she came and stayed in the castle of Bani Sa`ida. The Prophet (ﷺ) came out and went to 
her and entered upon her. Behold, it was a lady sitting with a drooping head. When the Prophet (ﷺ) spoke 
to her, she said, "I seek refuge with Allah from you." He said, "I grant you refuge from me." They said 
to her, "Do you know who this is?" She said, "No." They said, "This is Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) who has come 
to command your hand in marriage." She said, "I am very unlucky to lose this chance." Then the 
Prophet and his companions went towards the shed of Bani Sa`ida and sat there. Then he said, "Give 
us water, O Sahl!" So I took out this drinking bowl and gave them water in it. The sub-narrator added: 
Sahl took out for us that very drinking bowl and we all drank from it. Later on `Umar bin `Abdul 
`Aziz requested Sahl to give it to him as a present, and he gave it to him as a present.
question: How did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) respond to a woman's request for refuge from him?

hadith-eng:
I saw the drinking bowl of the Prophet (ﷺ) with Anas bin Malik, and it had been broken, and he had 
mended it with silver plates. That drinking bowl was quite wide and made of Nadar wood, Anas said, 
"I gave water to the Prophet (ﷺ) in that bowl more than so-and-so (for a long period)." Ibn Seereen said: 
Around that bowl there was an iron ring, and Anas wanted to replace it with a silver or gold ring, but 
Abu Talha said to him, "Do not change a thing that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) has made." So Anas left it as it 
was.
question: How did Anas bin Malik demonstrate his respect for the Prophet's belongings?

hadith-eng:
I was with the Prophet (ﷺ) and the time for the `Asr prayer became due. We had no water with us except a 
little which was put in a vessel and was brought to the Prophet (ﷺ) . He put his hand into it and spread out 
his fingers and then said, "Come along! Hurry up! All those who want to perform ablution. The 
blessing is from Allah.'' I saw the water gushing out from his fingers. So the people performed the 
ablution and drank, and I tried to drink more of that water (beyond my thirst and capacity), for I knew 
that it was a blessing. The sub-narrator said: I asked Jabir, "How many persons were you then?" He 
replied, "We were one-thousand four hundred men." Salim said: Jabir said, 1500.
question: How did the companions of the Prophet demonstrate their belief in the blessings of Allah during challenging situations?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "Whoever drinks alcoholic drinks in the world and does not repent (before 
dying), will be deprived of it in the Hereafter."
question: What is the significance of abstaining from alcohol in Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng:
On the night Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was taken on a night journey (Miraj) two cups, one containing wine and 
the other milk, were presented to him at Jerusalem. He looked at it and took the cup of milk. Gabriel 
said, "Praise be to Allah Who guided you to Al-Fitra (the right path); if you had taken (the cup of) 
wine, your nation would have gone astray."
question: What role does divine guidance play in making choices that affect the spiritual well-being of a community?

hadith-eng:
I heard from Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) a narration which none other than I will narrate to you. The Prophet, said, 
"From among the portents of the our are the following: General ignorance (in religious affairs) will 
prevail, (religious) knowledge will decrease, illegal sexual intercourse will prevail, alcoholic drinks 
will be drunk (in abundance), men will decrease and women will increase so much so that for every 
fifty women there will be one man to look after them."
question: What societal changes are indicated by the imbalance in the male-to-female ratio as a sign of the Hour?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "An adulterer, at the time he is committing illegal sexual intercourse is not a 
believer; and a person, at the time of drinking an alcoholic drink is not a believer; and a thief, at the 
time of stealing, is not a believer." Ibn Shihab said: `Abdul Malik bin Abi Bakr bin `Abdur-Rahman 
bin Al- Harith bin Hisham told me that Abu Bakr used to narrate that narration to him on the authority 
of Abu Huraira. He used to add that Abu Bakr used to mention, besides the above cases, "And he who 
robs (takes illegally something by force) while the people are looking at him, is not a believer at the 
time he is robbing (taking).
question: What are the implications of committing sins openly in front of others on a person's faith?

hadith-eng:
"Alcoholic drinks were prohibited (by Allah) when there was nothing of it (special kind of wine) in 
Medina.
question: What are the implications of prohibiting certain substances in Islamic law?

hadith-eng:
"Alcoholic drinks were prohibited at the time we could rarely find wine made from grapes in Medina, 
for most of our liquors were made from unripe and ripe dates.
question: What types of dates were used to make liquors in Medina before the prohibition of alcoholic drinks?

hadith-eng:
`Umar stood up on the pulpit and said, "Now then, prohibition of alcoholic drinks have been revealed, 
and these drinks are prepared from five things, i.e.. grapes, dates, honey, wheat or barley And an 
alcoholic drink is that, that disturbs the mind.
question: What was the role of Umar in communicating the prohibition of alcoholic drinks in Islam?

hadith-eng:
I was serving Abu 'Ubaida, Abu Talha and Ubai bin Ka`b with a drink prepared from ripe and unripe 
dates. Then somebody came to them and said, "Alcoholic drinks have been prohibited." (On hearing 
that) Abu Talha said, "Get up. O Anas, and pour (throw) it out! So I poured (threw) it out.
question: What does the immediate response of the companions to the prohibition of alcohol indicate about their commitment to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng:
While I was waiting on my uncles and serving them with (wine prepared from) dates----and I was the 
youngest of them----it was said, "Alcoholic drinks have been prohibited." So they said (to me), 
"Throw it away." So I threw it away.
question: What does this incident reveal about the immediate implementation of Islamic laws by the early Muslims?

hadith-eng:
Alcoholic drinks were prohibited. At that time these drinks used to be prepared from unripe and ripe 
dates.
question: What ingredients were commonly used to prepare alcoholic drinks before their prohibition in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was asked about Al-Bit. He said, "All drinks that intoxicate are unlawful (to drink.)
question: What guidance did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) provide regarding intoxicating beverages?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was asked about Al-Bit a liquor prepared from honey 
     which the Yemenites used to drink. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "All drinks 
     that intoxicate are unlawful (to drink)."
question: What guidance did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) provide regarding beverages made from honey that intoxicate?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "Do not make drinks in Ad-Dubba' nor in 
     Al-Muzaffat.  Abu Huraira used to add to them Al-Hantam and An-Naqir.
question: How do different narrators contribute to the understanding of prohibitions in Islamic traditions?

hadith-eng:
`Umar delivered a sermon on the pulpit of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ), saying, "Alcoholic drinks were prohibited 
by Divine Order, and these drinks used to be prepared from five things, i.e., grapes, dates, wheat, 
barley and honey. Alcoholic drink is that, that disturbs the mind." `Umar added, "I wish Allah's 
Apostle had not left us before he had given us definite verdicts concerning three matters, i.e., how 
much a grandfather may inherit (of his grandson), the inheritance of Al-Kalala (the deceased person 
among whose heirs there is no father or son), and various types of Riba(1 ) (usury) ."
question: What are some unresolved issues related to inheritance and usury that were highlighted by Umar?

hadith-eng:
"Alcoholic drinks are prepared from five things, i.e., raisins, dates.
     wheat, barley and honey."
question: What is the significance of identifying the ingredients used in making alcoholic beverages in Islamic jurisprudence?

hadith-eng:
that he heard the Prophet (ﷺ) saying, "From among my followers there will 
     be some people who will consider illegal sexual intercourse, the 
     wearing of silk, the drinking of alcoholic drinks and the use of 
     musical instruments, as lawful. And there will be some people who will
     stay near the side of a mountain and in the evening their shepherd 
     will come to them with their sheep and ask them for something, but 
     they will say to him, 'Return to us tomorrow.' Allah will destroy them
     during the night and will let the mountain fall on them, and He will 
     transform the rest of them into monkeys and pigs and they will remain 
     so till the Day of Resurrection."
question: What actions are highlighted as being wrongly considered permissible by some followers in the hadith?

hadith-eng:
Abu Usaid As-Sa`idi came and invited Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) on the occasion of his wedding. His wife who 
was the bride, was serving them. Do you know what drink she prepared for Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) ? She had 
soaked some dates in water in a Tur overnight.
question: What role did women play in social gatherings during the time of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade the use of (certain) containers, but the Ansar said, "We cannot dispense with 
them." The Prophet (ﷺ) then said, "If so, then use them."
question: What can be learned about the adaptability of Islamic teachings in response to the needs of the people?

hadith-eng:
When the Prophet (ﷺ) forbade the use of certain containers (that were used for preparing alcoholic drinks), 
somebody said to the Prophet (ﷺ) . "But not all the people can find skins." So he allowed them to use clay 
jars not covered with pitch.
question: What alternatives were provided for containers used in preparing alcoholic drinks according to the Prophet's (ﷺ) guidance?

hadith-eng: the Prophet (ﷺ) forbade the use of Ad-Dubba' and Al Muzaffat.A'mash also narrated this.
question: How does the prohibition of specific items reflect the broader principles of Islamic dietary or consumption laws?

hadith-eng:
I asked Al-Aswad, "Did you ask `Aisha, Mother of the Believers, about the containers in which it is 
disliked to prepare (non-alcoholic) drinks?" He said, "Yes, I said to her, 'O Mother of the Believers! 
What containers did the Prophet (ﷺ) forbid to use for preparing (non-alcoholic) drinks?" She said, 'The 
Prophet forbade us, (his family), to prepare (nonalcoholic) drinks in Ad-Dubba and Al-Muzaffat.' I 
asked, 'Didn't you mention Al Jar and Al Hantam?' She said, 'I tell what I have heard; shall I tell you 
what I have not heard?' "
question: What is the significance of narrating only what one has directly heard in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng:
I heard `Abdullah bin Abi `Aufa saying, "The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade the use of green jars." I said, "Shall we 
drink out of white jars?" He said, "No."
question: What might be the reasons behind the specific prohibition of green jars in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng:
Abu Usaid As Sa`idi invited the Prophet (ﷺ) to his wedding banquet. At that time his wife was serving 
them and she was the bride. She said, ''Do you know what (kind of syrup) I soaked (made) for Allah's 
Apostle? I soaked some dates in water in a Tur (bowl) overnight. '
question: What role did women play in serving guests during social gatherings in early Islamic society?

hadith-eng:
I asked Ibn `Abbas about Al-Badhaq. He said, "Muhammad prohibited alcoholic drinks before It was 
called Al-Badhaq (by saying), 'Any drink that intoxicates is unlawful.' I said, 'What about good lawful 
drinks?' He said,'Apart from what is lawful and good, all other things are unlawful and not good 
(unclean Al-Khabith).
question: What criteria determine whether a drink is considered unclean or prohibited in Islam?

hadith-eng: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to like sweet edible things and honey.
question: What can be learned about the dietary habits of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng:
While I was serving Abu Talha. Abu Dujana and Abu Suhail bin Al-Baida' with a drink made from a 
mixture of unripe and ripe dates, alcoholic drinks, were made unlawful, whereupon I threw it away, 
and I was their butler and the youngest of them, and we used to consider that drink as an alcoholic 
drink in those days.
question: What does this narration reveal about the practices and attitudes towards alcohol before its prohibition in Islam?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade the drinking of alcoholic drinks prepared from raisins, dates, unripe dates and 
fresh ripe dates.
question: What are the different sources from which alcoholic drinks can be made that are forbidden in Islam?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade the mixing of ripe and unripe dates and also the mixing of dates and raisins (for 
preparing a syrup) but the syrup of each kind of fruit should be prepared separately. ( One may have 
such drinks as long as it is fresh )
question: What are the conditions under which one may consume fruit syrups in Islam?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was presented a bowl of milk and a bowl of wine on the night he was taken on a 
journey (Al-Mi'raj).
question: How are symbolic choices used to convey messages in Islamic narratives?

hadith-eng:
The people doubted whether Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was fasting or the Day of `Arafat or not. So I sent a cup 
containing milk to him and he drank it.
question: What is the significance of verifying the fasting status of the Prophet (ﷺ) through a tangible action?

hadith-eng:
Abu Humaid brought a cup of mix from a place called Al-Naqi. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said to him, "Will you 
not cover it, even by placing a stick across its"
question: What are some simple methods to cover food and drink as advised in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng:
Abu Humaid, an Ansari man, came from AnNaqi carrying a cup of milk to the Prophet. The Prophet (ﷺ) 
said, "Will you not cover it even by placing a stick across it?"
question: What practical steps can be taken to safeguard consumables according to Islamic guidance?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (ﷺ) came from Mecca with Abu Bakr. Abu Bakr said "We passed by a shepherd and at that 
time Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was thirsty. I milked a little milk in a bowl and Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) drank till I was 
pleased. Suraqa bin Ju'shum came to us riding a horse (chasing us). The Prophet (ﷺ) invoked evil upon 
him, whereupon Suraqa requested him not to invoke evil upon him, in which case he would go back. 
The Prophet (ﷺ) agreed.
question: What does this incident reveal about the relationship between the Prophet (ﷺ) and his companions during difficult journeys?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "The best object of charity is a she-camel which has (newly) given birth and 
gives plenty of milk, or a she-goat which gives plenty of milk; and is given to somebody to utilize its 
milk by milking one bowl in the morning and one in the evening."
question: What are the benefits of giving a she-camel or she-goat in charity for both the giver and the receiver?

hadith-eng: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) drank milk and then rinsed his mouth and said, "It contains fat."
question: What can be inferred about the properties of milk from the actions of the Prophet (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng:
I was raised to the Lote Tree and saw four rivers, two of which were coming out and two going in. 
Those which were coming out were the Nile and the Euphrates, and those which were going in were two rivers in paradise. Then I was given three bowls, one containing milk, and another containing honey, and a third containing wine. I took the bowl containing milk and drank it. It was said to me, "You and your followers will be on the right path (of Islam)."
question: What is the symbolic meaning of the Prophet choosing the bowl of milk in the vision?

hadith-eng:
Abu Talha had the largest number of datepalms from amongst the Ansars of Medina. The dearest of 
his property to him was Bairuha garden which was facing the (Prophet's) Mosque. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) 
used to enter it and drink of its good fresh water. When the Holy Verse:-- 'By no means shall you 
attain righteousness unless you spend (in charity) of that which you love.' (3.92) was revealed, Abu 
Talha got up and said, "O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)! Allah says: By no means shall you attain righteousness 
unless you spend of that which you love,' and the dearest of my property to me is the Bairuha garden 
and I want to give it in charity in Allah's Cause, seeking to be rewarded by Allah for that. So you can 
spend it, O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ), where-ever Allah instructs you. ' Allah s Apostle said, "Good! That is a 
perishable (or profitable) wealth" (`Abdullah is in doubt as to which word was used.) He said, "I have 
heard what you have said but in my opinion you'd better give it to your kith and kin." On that Abu 
Talha said, "I will do so, O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)!" Abu Talha distributed that garden among his kith and kin 
and cousins.
question: What guidance did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) provide regarding the distribution of charity among relatives?

hadith-eng:
I saw Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) drinking milk. He came to my house and I milked a sheep and then mixed the 
milk with water from the well for Allah's Messenger (ﷺ). He took the bowl and drank while on his left there 
was sitting Abu Bakr, and on his right there was a bedouin. He then gave the remaining milk to the 
bedouin and said, "The right! The right (first).
question: What can be learned about the social interactions and manners of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) from this event?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and one of his companions entered upon an Ansari man and the Prophet (ﷺ) said to him, 
"If you have water kept overnight in a water skin, (give us), otherwise we will drink water by putting 
our mouth in it." The man was watering his garden then. He said, "O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)! I have water 
kept overnight; let us go to the shade." So he took them both there and poured water into a bowl and 
milked a domestic goat of his in it. Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) drank, and then the man who had come along with 
him, drank.
question: What can be learned about the Prophet's (ﷺ) approach to simplicity and humility from his willingness to drink water directly from a container?

hadith-eng: The Prophet (ﷺ) used to like sweet edible things (syrup, etc.) and honey.
question: What can be learned about the dietary habits of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) from his liking for sweet things?

hadith-eng:
Ali came to the gate of the courtyard (of the Mosque) and drank (water) while he was standing and 
said, "Some people dislike to drink while standing, but I saw the Prophet (ﷺ) doing (drinking water) as 
you have seen me doing now."
question: What are the differing opinions among people regarding drinking water while standing, and how are they addressed in Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng:
`Ali offered the Zuhr prayer and then sat down in the wide courtyard (of the Mosque) of Kufa in order 
to deal with the affairs of the people till the `Asr prayer became due. Then water was brought to him 
and he drank of it, washed his face, hands, head and feet. Then he stood up and drank the remaining 
water while he was standing. and said, "Some people dislike to drink water while standing thought the 
Prophet did as I have just done."
question: How did Ali address the people's affairs between the Zuhr and Asr prayers?

hadith-eng: The Prophet (ﷺ) drank Zamzam (water) while standing.
question: What are the etiquettes of drinking water according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng:
(daughter of Al-Harith) that she sent a bowl of milk to the Prophet (ﷺ) while he was standing (at `Arafat) 
in the afternoon of the Day of `Arafat. He took it in his hands and drank it. Narrated Abu Nadr: The 
Prophet was on the back of his camel.
question: What can be inferred about the Prophet's practices during the pilgrimage from his actions at Arafat?

hadith-eng:
Milk mixed with water was brought to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) while a bedouin was on his right and Abu Bakr 
was on his left. He drank (of it) and then gave (it) to the bedouin and said, 'The right" "The right 
(first).
question: What can be learned about the distribution of food and drink from the actions of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) was offered something to drink. He drank of it while on his right was a boy and on his 
left were some elderly people. He said to the boy, "May I give these (elderly) people first?" The boy 
said, "By Allah, O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)! I will not give up my share from you to somebody else." On that 
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) placed the cup in the hand of that boy.
question: What can be learned about the importance of fulfilling promises and respecting the rights of the young in Islam from this event?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (ﷺ) and one of his companions entered upon an Ansari man. The Prophet (ﷺ) and his companion 
greeted (the man) and he replied, "O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)! Let my father and mother be sacrificed for you! 
It is hot," while he was watering his garden. The Prophet (ﷺ) asked him, "If you have water kept overnight 
in a water skin, (give us), or else we will drink by putting our mouths in the basin." The man was 
watering the garden The man said, "O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)! I have water kept overnight in a water-skin. He 
went to the shade and poured some water into a bowl and milked some milk from a domestic goat in 
it. The Prophet (ﷺ) drank and then gave the bowl to the man who had come along with him to drink.
question: What can be learned about the Prophet's (ﷺ) humility and simplicity from his interaction with the Ansari man?

hadith-eng:
I was waiting on my uncles, serving them with an alcoholic drink prepared from dates, and I was the 
youngest of them. (Suddenly) it was said that alcoholic drinks had been prohibited. So they said (to 
me), 'Throw it away." And I threw it away The sub-narrator said: I asked Anas what their drink was 
(made from), He replied, "(From) ripe dates and unripe dates."
question: What ingredients were used in the preparation of alcoholic drinks by the companions before the prohibition?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "When night falls (or when it is evening), stop your children from going out, for 
the devils spread out at that time. But when an hour of the night has passed, release them and close the 
doors and mention Allah's Name, for Satan does not open a closed door. Tie the mouth of your waterskin 
and mention Allah's Name; cover your containers and utensils and mention Allah's Name. Cover 
them even by placing something across it, and extinguish your lamps. "
question: What actions are recommended to ensure safety and protection during the night according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "Extinguish the lamps when you go to bed; close your doors; tie the mouths of 
your water skins, and cover the food and drinks." I think he added, ". . . even with a stick you place 
across the container."
question: What are the recommended practices for handling food and drink containers in Islam?

hadith-eng: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade the bending of the mouths of water skins for the sake of drinking from them.
question: How does Islamic teaching address the manner in which one should drink water or other beverages?

hadith-eng:
I heard Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbidding the drinking of water by bending the mouths of water skins, i.e., 
drinking from the mouths directly.
question: Why might it be important to follow specific guidelines when consuming food or drink in Islam?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) forbade drinking directly from the mouth of a water skin or other leather containers. 
and forbade preventing one's neighbor from fixing a peg in (the wall of) one's house.
question: What are the implications of preventing a neighbor from utilizing shared spaces or resources?

hadith-eng: The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade the drinking of water directly from the mouth of a water skin .
question: Why might the Prophet (ﷺ) have advised against drinking directly from a water skin?

hadith-eng: The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade the drinking of water direct from the mouth of a water-skin.
question: How does the prohibition of certain practices reflect the Prophet's concern for the well-being of his followers?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "When you drink (water), do not breath in the vessel; and when you urinate, do 
not touch your penis with your right hand. And when you cleanse yourself after defecation, do not use 
your right hand."
question: What are the Islamic guidelines for maintaining cleanliness after using the restroom?

hadith-eng:
Anas used to breathe twice or thrice in the vessel (while drinking) and used to say that the Prophet; 
used to take three breaths while drinking.
question: What can be learned from the drinking habits of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) as narrated by his companions?

hadith-eng:
While Hudhaita was at Mada'in, he asked for water. The chief of the village brought him a silver 
vessel. Hudhaifa threw it away and said, "I have thrown it away because I told him not to use it, but he 
has not stopped using it. The Prophet (ﷺ) forbade us to wear clothes of silk or Dibaj, and to drink in gold 
or silver utensils, and said, 'These things are for them (unbelievers) in this world and for you 
(Muslims) in the Hereafter.' "
question: What is the significance of adhering to the Prophet's prohibitions in daily life?

hadith-eng:
The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Do not drink in gold or silver utensils, and do not wear clothes of silk or Dibaj, for 
these things are for them (unbelievers) in this world and for you in the Hereafter."
question: What is the significance of distinguishing between the permissible and impermissible in Islam regarding worldly luxuries?

hadith-eng:
(the wife of the Prophet) Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "He who drinks in silver utensils is only filling his 
`Abdomen with Hell Fire."
question: How does the use of certain materials for utensils relate to the concept of punishment in Islam?

hadith-eng:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) ordered us to do seven things and forbade us from seven. He ordered us to visit the 
sick, to follow funeral processions, (to say) to a sneezer, (May Allah bestow His Mercy on you, if he 
says, Praise be to Allah), to accept invitations, to greet (everybody), to help the oppressed and to help 
others to fulfill their oaths. He forbade us to wear gold rings, to drink in silver (utensils), to use 
Mayathir (silken carpets placed on saddles), to wear Al-Qissi (a kind of silken cloth), to wear silk, 
Dibaj or Istabraq (two kinds of silk).
question: How does this narration guide Muslims in their social interactions and personal conduct?

hadith-eng:
that the people were in doubt whether the Prophet (ﷺ) was fasting on the Day of `Arafat or not, so a 
(wooden) drinking vessel full of milk was sent to him, and he drank it.
question: What significance does the Day of `Arafat hold in Islamic tradition, and how is it observed?

hadith-eng:
An Arab lady was mentioned to the Prophet (ﷺ) so he asked Abu Usaid As-Sa`idi to send for her, and he 
sent for her and she came and stayed in the castle of Bani Sa`ida. The Prophet (ﷺ) came out and went to 
her and entered upon her. Behold, it was a lady sitting with a drooping head. When the Prophet (ﷺ) spoke 
to her, she said, "I seek refuge with Allah from you." He said, "I grant you refuge from me." They said 
to her, "Do you know who this is?" She said, "No." They said, "This is Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) who has come 
to command your hand in marriage." She said, "I am very unlucky to lose this chance." Then the 
Prophet and his companions went towards the shed of Bani Sa`ida and sat there. Then he said, "Give 
us water, O Sahl!" So I took out this drinking bowl and gave them water in it. The sub-narrator added: 
Sahl took out for us that very drinking bowl and we all drank from it. Later on `Umar bin `Abdul 
`Aziz requested Sahl to give it to him as a present, and he gave it to him as a present.
question: What can be learned from the companions' interaction with the Prophet (ﷺ) regarding marriage proposals?

hadith-eng:
I saw the drinking bowl of the Prophet (ﷺ) with Anas bin Malik, and it had been broken, and he had 
mended it with silver plates. That drinking bowl was quite wide and made of Nadar wood, Anas said, 
"I gave water to the Prophet (ﷺ) in that bowl more than so-and-so (for a long period)." Ibn Seereen said: 
Around that bowl there was an iron ring, and Anas wanted to replace it with a silver or gold ring, but 
Abu Talha said to him, "Do not change a thing that Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) has made." So Anas left it as it 
was.
question: What can be learned from Abu Talha's advice regarding the alteration of the Prophet's possessions?

hadith-eng:
I was with the Prophet (ﷺ) and the time for the `Asr prayer became due. We had no water with us except a 
little which was put in a vessel and was brought to the Prophet (ﷺ) . He put his hand into it and spread out 
his fingers and then said, "Come along! Hurry up! All those who want to perform ablution. The 
blessing is from Allah.'' I saw the water gushing out from his fingers. So the people performed the 
ablution and drank, and I tried to drink more of that water (beyond my thirst and capacity), for I knew 
that it was a blessing. The sub-narrator said: I asked Jabir, "How many persons were you then?" He 
replied, "We were one-thousand four hundred men." Salim said: Jabir said, 1500.
question: What role does the Prophet's actions play in providing guidance and reassurance to his followers in times of need?
